servinfo.title: DTC B1333 / B1337: Left / Right Side Curtain-Air Bag Initiator Circuit Short to Ground

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC B1331 / B1335: Left / Right Side Curtain-Air Bag Initiator Circuit Resistance High .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

servinfosub.title: DTC Will Set when
servinfosub.ptxt: The voltage measured at side curtain-air bag (left or right) initiator circuit is below a specified value for specified time.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check whether malfunction is in side curtain-air bag (inflator) module.
Step 2: Check side curtain-air bag initiator circuit.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, remove rear side upper trim of left or right side and disconnect side curtain-air bag (inflator) module connector.
Check proper connection to side-air bag (inflator) module at terminals in “G18” or “G41” connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (A), (B) and (C) to side curtain-air bag (inflator) module connector.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1333 or B1337 still indicated?

paragroup.ptxt: Replace side curtain-air bag (inflator) module referring to Side Curtain-Air Bag (Inflator) Module Removal and Installation .

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect SDM connector “L32”.
Release shorting bar in SDM connector inserting release tool (1) included in special tool (A).

Measure resistance between “L32-1” and body ground, and between “L32-2” and body ground (for DTC B1333) or “L32-3” and body ground, and between “L32-4” and body ground (for DTC B1337) with connected special tools (A), (B) and (C).

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.

paragroup.ptxt: DTC B1333: Repair short from “YEL/GRN” or “YEL/BLU” wire circuit to ground.
DTC B1337: Repair short from “BLK/YEL” or “BRN/YEL” wire circuit to ground.

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components, ensure all components are properly mounted.
Clear DTCs referring to DTC Clearance , if any.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
